citation.article-title: Enterococcus haemoperoxidus sp. nov. and Enterococcus moraviensis sp. nov., isolated from water.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Enterococcus haemoperoxidus sp. nov.

Enterococcus haemoperoxidus (hae.mo.per.o'xi.dus. G. n. haema blood; per G. prefix intensification; oxys G. adj. sour; N. L. adj. haemoperoxidus blood peroxide, derived from the ability of the species to decompose hydrogen peroxide into oxygen and water when cultivated on blood-agar media)
Cells are Gram-positive, ovoid cocci, occurring in pairs, short chains or small groups.
They are elongated in the direction of the chains.
Non-motile.
A slightly yellowish pigment may be produced; this pigment is most readily visible when growth is collected from plates within inoculation loops.
A positive catalase reaction is clearly evident when cultivated on blood agar, but cells grown on blood-free medium are catalase-negative.
Weakly positive in the amylase test.
Streptococcal group D antigen-positive.
Growth characteristics and physiological traits are as described above.

Acid is produced from glycerol, ribose, galactose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, methyl α-D-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, sucrose, trehalose, melezitose, β-gentiobiose and maltotriose.
Most strains produce acid from starch.

Acid is not produced from erythritol, D- or L-arabinose, D- or L-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, L-sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, sorbitol, methyl α-D-mannoside, melibiose, inulin, D-raffinose, xylitol, D-lyxose, D-tagatose, D- or L-fucose, D- or L-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate or 5-ketogluconate.
Most strains do not produce acid from glycogen and D-turanose.
Mannitol acidification is variable.

Positive in tests for acetoin, hippurate, aesculin, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, leucine arylamidase and arginine dihydrolase; negative for bglucuronidase, β-galactosidase, alkaline phosphatase and urease.
Most strains are α-galactosidase-negative.

Positive enzymic hydrolysis of 4-methylumbelliferyl (4MU) β-D-glucoside, L-pyroglutamic acid 7-amido-4-methyl coumarin (AMC), L-tryptophan, 4MU N-acetyl β-D-glucosaminide, p-nitrophenyl β-dcellobioside and p-nitrophenyl α-D-maltoside; mostly positive for L-phenylalanine AMC, 4MU α-D-glucoside, proline and leucine p-nitroanilide and o-nitrophenyl β-D-galactoside.
Negative for hydrolysis of L-valine, 4MU phosphate, 4MU β-D-glucuronide and L-isoleucine.
Variable enzymic hydrolysis of pnitrophenyl β-D-glucoside and p-nitrophenyl phosphate.
The type strain, 440T (=CCM4851T=LMG19487T), was isolated from service (non-potable) water and its characteristics agree with the species description above.
Tests that are variable for E. haemoperoxidus strains give the following results for strain 440T: positive acidification of starch; negative for mannitol, glycogen and D-turanose.
Weakly positive for agalactosidase.
Positive for enzymic hydrolysis of 4MU α-D-glucoside, L-phenylalanine AMC, proline and leucine p-nitroanilide, o-nitrophenyl β-D-galactoside, p-nitrophenyl β-D-glucoside and p-nitrophenyl phosphate.
The strain is not pigmented.
The G+­C content of strain 440T is 35.3 mol%.
